author: Special Correspondent
text:
put to hardship:A view of the heavy traffic on Mount Road in Chennai on Tuesday.- Photo: M. Moorthy

The protest meeting organised by the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam resulted in a traffic gridlock in different parts of Central Chennai. Hundreds of motorists were trapped on Anna Salai, Kamarajar Salai and other arterial roads.

Residents irked

Roads branching off these main roads were also choked with traffic.

Residents and motorists were visibly angry.

“Last week, it was the ruling All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam. Now it is the Opposition and we have to suffer every time. I was trapped in Pudupet for nearly 30 minutes,” said M. Dinakaran, a sales executive.

M. Jagadish, who was stuck on Anna Salai said: “Such protests should be organised in open grounds. It is surprising that the government and police grant permission to hold agitations at important public places, resulting in only inconvenience to the people,” he said.

The DMK had organised a meeting demanding a judicial inquiry into the opening of the shutters of Chembarambakkam reservoir in the first week of December.

Police said that as many as 7,000 DMK members took part in the protest that went on till noon. “The number of people increased when the party president M. Karunanidhi reachearound 11.30 a.m.,” they said.
title: Protest meeting cripples traffic
